description:
Yet another cupcake joint in the FiDi, but I'm not complaining.  A perfect afternoon pick me up; one cupcake will be fine to satisfy that sweet tooth.  They have some the favorite flavors every other shop has, but also introduce their own unique cupcakes like tres leches.

Tres Leches Cupcake: The "frosting" seems to be just whipped cream from a can.  The cake, however is amazing.  So moist and rich.  And to make it even richer, there was like a little bit cream/custard flowing out of the center and down to the bottom.

Chocolate Tres Leches Cupcake: Like the Tres Leches Cupcakes, but with chocolate cake and chocolate "frosting" (also whipped cream consistency).  I liked the "frosting" better on this one, but felt the original had a better cake.  The chocolate cake seemed drier with less leche absorbed.  Maybe they just happened to use less?

Vanilla Cake Pop: Looked quite cool with sparkling pink glitter.  Tasted like a store bought cake pop though.  Thick white chocolate shell with a pasty vanilla cake center.  Probably best to stick with the cupcakes instead.
author: Adam B.

description:
Sooooooo good! I called ahead and asked whether they were able to accommodate me walking in to pick up 2 dozen cupcakes and they said it was no problem so I walked in around 2 and ordered a mix of 2 dozen cupcakes. The girl at the register put in a mix of cupcakes for me in boxes but unfortunately they did not have bags so I had to carry 2 boxes of cupcakes across multiple city blocks hoping I don't trip and fall flat into all those cupcakes.

I've tried a lot of cupcakes across the city - especially some of the chains like Kara and Cako and this place is so much better! Prior to this if I craved a cupcake I would go to Cako because it's generally more convenient and I find their cakes less disgustingly sweet. But I'm just going to come to La Luna from now on. 

The prices are on par with all the other boutique cupcake shops - $3.50 for one, $40 a dozen. They also have gluten free and vegan cupcakes! 

Of all the variety, I tried the red velvet and the cappucino. OMG THE CAPPUCINO WAS SO GOOD. There was a light whip filling in the middle of a chocolate cake. (It can use a bit stronger coffee flavor in the cake) The red velvet was very standard - but the cream cheese frosting was very light and less sweet than other places which I love. 

The cakes are extremely moist and does not have the cloyingly fake sweetness in cupcakes at so many other places. Definitely would recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet treat in the middle of their day!
author: Judy H.

description:
Mm, tasty cupcakes in the middle of FiDi! True to the nature of my visit, this is a short review saying that if you want a midday pick-me-up, La Luna Cupcakes are the way to go.

I cashed in on a promise my significant other made me a year ago to buy me a really good cupcake, and we stopped in to get a regular-sized chocolate tres leches cupcake for $3.50. For eating in, we were served the cake on a china plate with a plastic fork and napkin. The cake was moist and not at all crumbly, and about halfway through, we hit tres leches gold. The frosting was sweet without being sugary, and was adorably topped with some semisweet chocolate chips. Think chocolate lover's dream, only better.

Other flavors I saw in the display included original tres leches, red velvet, and mocha. Someone in the back was packaging beautifully-made cake pops, which would make a cute office treat. Since it's difficult to find high-quality snacks at a good price point around here, I'd make the short walk over for these.
author: Gwen W.

description: Decent cupcake place, but nothing too fancy. I would order again simply for the cake pops.
author: Grace P.

description: I stumbled across this place on my way back to work. I had just finished lunch upstairs. The first thing that struck me about this place was how decorative it was! There were so many flavors of cupcakes in the display case. I went with the hot chocolate cupcake. Minus one star because it wasn't filled to the top of the liner. However, the cupcake itself was very rich in chocolate flavor and moist! The whipped cream frosting was also light and not overly sweet. I thought that the garnish of marshmallows and chocolate straw were a nice addition. Overall, maybe not worth it if you're coming here all the time. But if you want to treat yourself and have a craving for a cupcake, this place is definitely worth a try!
author: Cynthia T.

description: Small number of flavors but some were unique. I got the hot chocolate, tres leches and red velvet which were good.
author: Sunil R.

description:
So I've been eating way too many sweets lately and this was my last cupcake stop and ....is it too early in our relationship to say that I may be in love with La Luna???They had two flavors that just spoke to me and were not doubt about it selections for me:

1) Tres leches 
2) Chocolate Vanilla 

These two flavors were awesome, moist and just pretty darn good. My favorite cupcake place so far in SF and I've been to a few.

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places. 
1 Neighbor Bakehouse=cinammon almond bostock
2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake
4 Ariscault =Croissant
5 Yasukochis=Coffee Crunch Cake
6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies
7 Dynamo Donuts=donuts
8 Golden Gate Bakery=Egg tart
9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description: I placed an order for some mini cupcakes for an office event. I chose the tres leches and cookies & cream. It's in a plaza alley way, very convenient location close to Montgomery Bart Station. The shop itself is very cute and cozy. When I arrived my pickup order was ready, but I wanted to make a couple of changes and they were more than willing to help me out! The cupcakes were also very moist and delicious. I put the leftovers in the fridge for a couple of days, and they still stayed fresh and moist. Also loved how they offered vegan and gluten free options so everyone in our office could enjoy the cupcakes.
author: Hannah K.

description:
OMG this place.  My first introduction to La Luna was cupcakes someone brought into the office for another colleagues birthday.  I actually didn't eat the cupcakes, but they looked pretty delicious.

The next introduction was when my office ordered cake pops into the office for one of our office-wide meetings.  They came in three flavours vanilla, chocolate and red velvet.  I grabbed a chocolate one and OMG this is probably the most delicious dessert I've had in San Francisco.  The cake is so moist it is more like eating fudge.  I had to restrain myself from immediately gathering another.

That was about a month and a half ago.  Then yesterday I went to their bakery and picked one up.  A treat for $2.50 a pop!  Equally delicious.  We also had them in the office again today for someone's birthday.

I LOVE THESE CAKE POPS.  Go eat them now.
author: Jade R.

description:
Great bakery, great baked items, great customer service.

We ordered cake pops as party favors for a bachlorette party. We only thought of it a few days before and thought we might have missed the boat.

Called LA Luna, and they couldn't have been nicer. I explained what we wanted, and everything was no problem.

They delivered within one minute of the asking time, and the cake pops were beautiful, even nicer than expected.  Our guests and bride-to-be couldn't have been more excited. 

Thank you LA Luna, you helped to make the evening more special.
author: S R.

description:
After walk pass this joint billion of times.  I have decided to give this place a try since I was craving for something sweet.  I got 6 cupcakes to share with my friends.  I got 2 red velvet, 2 mocha, and 2 nutella.  out of the 3 flavors, I really like the nutella.  the frosting and the cake was just perfect.  they are not super sweet and heavy, which is perfect.  

the red velvet and mocha.  the cake was ok.  the cake was a little bit on the drier side, flavor is there though.  has room to improve.  but their frosting was really good. maybe they should add little bit more frosting inside of the cake to balance a little bit.  I think that would be a great idea. 

service was really nice.  the person who was helping me was very patient with me while trying to decide what to get.  

will try other flavors to make final judgments.  stay tune.
author: Candice Y.

description:
Came here to pick up cupcakes for my coworkers and another time for myself. 

The cupcakes here are everything you want in a cupcake. Great texture, frosting, flavor, and presentation. Have tried chocolate-vanilla, vanilla, and dolce leche and they have all been so good. To get more variety in flavors you must come here early because the good ones get taken quick. I have always wanted to try their Neapolitan, strawberry, hot chocolate and more, but they have only had in stock the flavors I mentioned before. You can always call ahead to see what flavors they still have. This is a great place to get yourself a treat, or surprise someone with cupcakes. 

The staff is very nice and carefully puts the cupcakes in the to go tray for you. 

DELICIOUS and I will be back :)
author: Hayley D.

description: I pre ordered cupcakes for a birthday and was able to order the flavors I wanted (even though they were selling a particular flavor that day). The strawberry, cookies and cream, and tres leches are delicious! Staff was really nice and accommodating.
author: Megan J.

description: While visiting San Francisco I picked up half a dozen for my friend's birthday. They were amazing! I wish I lived in town so I could have them more often.
author: Jessica R.

description:
These are absolute favorite cupcakes in San Francisco !! They are soft creamy & perfectly sweet!! The chocolate & tres leche flavours are amazing!
Plus they decorate them specially for every occasion!!
author: Megha L.

description:
I wanted to surprise my girlfriend with a good luck cupcake for an interview she was having. Looked on Yelp for an bakery in FiDi and found this place. 

The place itself is very clean and nice. There were 2 women working and about 4 customers, one of whom had a very large order (it was clear she'd been there before). They were courteous and took care of me quickly. 

I got the Chocolate Tres Leches cupcake. It was very delicious and moist. The inside was perfectly moist. My girlfriend got the chocolate cupcake and she was a big fan as well. 

I'm not really a dessert eater but I will definitely be back some time soon. Very good cupcakes.
author: Nick D.

description: Literally the only place in Union Square/Financial District with vegan treats. The vegan red velvet cupcake is to die for!
author: Sydney T.

description: I wasn't terribly impressed. The selection was small when we went and the cupcakes themselves (we got minis) were rich but not really flavorful.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Our office brought in a variety of cupcakes for treats for our Halloween party. First time tasting their cupcakes, and I am hooked. I had their red velvet cupcake topped with an adorable cookie witch. It was moist and delicious and it had just the right amount of frosting. I can't wait for the next family event just so I can order some!
author: Grace A.

description:
Ordered 18 cupcakes for team meeting.  Product is always great.  What set this experience apart was the level of communication and customer service.
I ordered late in the day for next day delivery.  After hours, Elvia responded promptly to confirm my order, details and delivery instructions.  Due to the quick turnaround, I really appreciated the personal touch and comfort of knowing my order would be fulfilled.
Great job!  I will highly recommend.
author: Matt A.

description:
I absolutely love this place, the cupcakes are moist and decadent but not too sweet. I usually don't eat cupcakes due to the mouth-achingly sweetness of the frosting but they make it just right, here. 

If you are a chocolate lover, go for the chocolate cupcakes. The classic vanilla ones are good too. 

Their cake pops are my addiction and you might be able to get them customized as well. Their Easter collection is absolutely adorable!!
author: Debbie L.

description:
These are the best cupcakes. Im not exaggerating when I say the best. The cake is super moist and the frosting is very creamy without being overly sweet. I have tried every cupcake they make and you can't go wrong with any one option. 

My most favorite cupcake though is the chocolate tres leches. It's basically chocolate heaven. The customer service is always friendly, they are eager to help you and get you your cupcakes. The shop is cute and the decor makes you want to sit down and enjoy the moment.
author: Swetha M.

description:
This review is only about their Mocha cupcake. I was able to sample their catering and had the Mocha cupcake and it was absolutely heavenly.  The chocolate cake was super moist and the espresso buttercream on top was light but super rich in coffee flavor.  As a coffee lover, this was a perfect treat!  The icing was also topped off with a chocolate covered espresso bean.

I'm surprised that the reviews here seem so contrary to my experience so I wonder if they are not very consistent in their quality.  As I said, I've only tried their cupcakes once so I'll have to try it again to see if it's just as good!
author: Jess Y.

description:
Have to give a shout out to La Luna Cupcakes.  I've had these cupcakes now more often for department birthdays and special events.  After I found out how tasty these cupcakes were and what they charged for them, I also went to get a dozen of these cupcakes myself and I ended up saving the equivalent of a FiDi sandwich.  

In downtown SF, it's hard to find anything that is affordable but La Luna is an exception that is probably not very well known either.  

Give them a try if you work or live near here to get quality for a better price!
author: Ben H L.

description: Sweetest service ever! The man who rang me up was so king and had a smile on his face the whole time. I wish I took a picture of my beautiful cupcake. They are fresh, fluffy and delicious. The red velvet and cream cheese frosting was to die for!!
author: Vanessa D.

description: Tried 3 different cupcakes today: strawberry , Tres Leche, and another one with alcohol infused in it. The cupcakes where perfection. Moist but not overly sweet. Jesus helped me and took the time to explain what was in each. I would go back! This is my new go to cupcake and cake pop place!
author: Cindy S.

description: The tres leches cupcakes at La Luna are my go to for an afternoon sweet tooth craving. I love the fluffy light texture and creamy interior. They have denser versions of cupcakes with rotating flavors too but I always go back for the vanilla tres leches. It also comes in a chocolate version. Yum!
author: Jaime L.

description: We ordered the Vanilla Chocolate and the Red Velvet. Both cupcakes were Very dry. Not that flavorful. The cream on top was very buttery with little flavor as well. The staff was really nice
author: Alaa H.

description: Their chocolate tres leche cupcake is amazing! It's maybe even a little too moist, if that's at all possible... I recommend eating it with a spoon because the inside is soaked with 3 types of milk. Yum!
author: Elena K.

description:
This is a beautiful little cupcake and more shop. They make cake pops, serve coffee or tea, yogurt, and do beautiful custom designs. 
Jesus, who was helping me was super helpful and attentive.I got to sample the cookies, I bought the coconut cupcake and a chocolate one for my friend. 
He gave me the logo they made it for the Warriors team recently too!
author: Tere C.

description:
We were having happy hour for a girlfriend's birthday and someone brought cupcakes from La Luna.

I ended up trying the Sunny vanilla: rich vanilla cake with vanilla frosting. The frosting was light and creamy, but the cake was a little dry. I ended up only eating about half of it. It did have great vanilla flavor, but the frosting wasn't enough to cut into the dryness of every bite.

My girlfriends ate the Mars red velvet & Asteroid cookies & cream and enjoyed them. They finished the entire cupcake.

Maybe it's just me, but I thought the cupcakes were okay. Could have had more moisture. I wouldn't mind coming back to try the Tres leches. Everyone seems to rave about that cupcake. Next time!
author: Elena N.

description: Tasty cupcakes in a variety of flavors. Best of all, they are next door to my office, so I can quickly pick up celebratory treats in a pinch!
author: Kitty K.

description: I bought a dozen of their cupcakes for my team - cookies & cream, red velvet, mint choco chip, and coconut. I myself ate two - Cookies & cream and red velvet.  To be honest, it was quite underwhelming; I greatly prefer Kara's or Cako. I am not a huge fan of this frosting; the cookies&cream frosting tasted ultra heavy and thick. I'm sure some people enjoy it that way but for me, it just seemed a little much like taking a bite of oreo filling mixed with butter.  My team mates gave similarly underwhelmed responses.  One guy didn't even finish his - and who doesn't finish a cupcake?!  (Another said the coconut flavor was good, so there's that).
author: Evelyn T.

description:
We had the best experience with this business - so much so that they've prompted my first Yelp review! 

A co-worker and I went into La Luna Cupcakes a couple of days ago and ordered a dozen pink cake pops for another co-worker's surprise office baby shower. First of all the place smells AMAZING. This is what cupcake dreams are made of. The man behind the counter guided us through the order and told us about all of our different options for flavors and decorations. We paid there (very competitive pricing btw), and I picked up the cake pops this morning. They turned out perfect and were a huge hit at our party. 

Awesome customer service and super high quality product! Thank you!
author: Rowan E.

description:
AVERAGE cupcakes. BRING CASH, or you would be charged an $0.85 cent charge for using your card. NO APPLE PAY either! #FirstWorldProblems 

The cupcake itself without the frosting is very plain ( think Wonder Bread ). The frosting is good though. But, honestly, I would NOT come here again. The staff was pretty friendly though. Even though the place is cute, it was empty when I went in during lunch hour. Overall, this place is meh.....
author: Katy W.

description:
$3.50 for a regular size cupcake. $1.50 for a tiny one.

Looking from the outside and walking in, you could see all the pretty little cupcakes and cake pops they have on display. Everything looks so yummy and delicious that you wouldn't want to touch it. Personally, I think the small ones are a little pricey but sometimes, you just want a taste and not waste a giant one.

Had a taste of the mini chocolate cupcake. It was definitely very chocolatey. The frosting tasted a little bit powdery in my opinion. It was still yummy. Cupcake was moist (a little longer, it would have been dry).

Giving it 3 stars for now. I want to try the other ones there before I can claim to be a fan :)
author: Benita M.

description: Cupcakes are very nice, sometimes a little too moist but overall nice. Large selection so convenient for last minute celebrations
author: Anne-Marie R.

description:
I walked passed La Luna walking back to my car, but the place looked so good that I backtracked and got a couple of cupcakes. They were the best ones I've ever had ( Tres leches). They were not too sweet or fake like a lot of cupcake places. Everything about them was perfect. The man who took care of us was very nice as well.
I will go back as soon as I can.
author: Nataly B.

description: Holy melt in your mouth and not too sweet goodness. I came by here with a colleague after seeing the shop. While we already had sweets in hand, I said I would come back the following day and I am so glad I did. I tried the mint chocolate cupcake and my god, the cake itself is so moist. Often, the cream on top is too sweet for me but this was the perfect amount. Give it a try. :)
author: Leslie L.

description: I tried the Chocolate Vanilla cupcake and it was delicious! The frosting was creamy and the cupcake itself was of good quality, although a little on the too-sweet side. Would definitely come back again to try their other flavours!
author: Surashree K.

description: These cupcakes taste like Safeway store bought. The les leche cupcake is like Chinese sweet milk and they made that a flavor into their cupcake . I honestly don't understand how this place has such high ratings . The red velvets frosting was very creamy / almost liquidity. These are home made and look home made. Amauteur Safeway cupcakes
author: Russell T.

description:
After taking my hubbles to Crocker Galleria today, my sweettooth was acting up and I was in the mood for cuppycakes.

How convenient of this place to be right next to the dang chessboard. After having lunch at the Fountain Cafe and spending a good 15 minutes watching the hubs play chess again, i decided to stop in and check this place out.

It's a pretty spacious little cupcake store with about two small tables and one long table by the front for sitting, if not the outdoor seating area. The cupcakes are neatly stacked in separate circular trays and come in two different sizes. There are about 8 flavors: vanilla, cookies&cream, chocolate, red velvet, lemon, gluten-free carrotcake, coconut, and their most popular tres leches. Thw mini cupcakes are $1.50 each and the bigger cupcakes are $3.50 each. 

The man working the counter was so nice. He must've figured that it was our first time, so he let us sample the tres leches mini cupcake for free. It was really decadent with the frosting, and when you bite into it more you get the leches which is muy bueno for me!

We bought 4 mini cupcakea for $6. 
- Vanilla: tasted like a standars vanilla cupcake from Luckys or any other supermarket store. Frosting was thick, but cake was vanilla moist.
- Cookies&Cream: dont hurt me, but I am not the biggest fan of chocolate. So i didnt fancy this one so much. The cake was super chocolatey and sweet. A bit too sweet for my palate, but the hubz liked it.
- Red velvet: i LOVE red velvet, so this one was a plus for me. Cream cheese frosting had a tartness that mixed well with the red velvet cake. Moist cake + whipped frosting = yummies.
- Tres Leches: This one was my favorite, hands down. Cake was soft and moist and it didnt crumble even thougg there was some milk there. The frosting was sweet but it wasnt too thick or soggy.

They have cakepops here for $2 i believe. You can do combos here and each are $5.
- Soda + cupcake =$5
- Coffee + cupcake =$5
- Yogurt + cupcake =$5

Overall a nice experience. I'd come back to try the others one day heh.

Big thanks to Albertino M. for the tres leches suggestion again! :)
author: Jerianne G.

description: Guy working was super sweet. Cake pops were delicious and relatively inexpensive! :)
author: H L.

description: Ordered for my co worker birthday. Cupcakes were average. Even though allot of the flavors are really just chocolate cake with different toppings, she enjoyed it.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Tried a variety of cupcakes here and like they 3 star rating category-- its "A-OK". I think their most unique flavor is the tres leches cupcakes, which would be the only flavor I'd get more than once. The Napoleon cupcake cake was so sweet itself that you can hardly taste the strawberry frosting! 

Price is pretty high PER cupcake-- a regular sized tres leches cupcake costs me about $4.50! 

Staff doesn't seem too friendly OR knowledgeable. They didn't tell me about the cupcake flavors that were available, but not on display nor did they seem to know the answer when I simply asked for the cupcake topper's price. 

Overall, standard good(ish) cupcakes and probably not worth the price tag.
author: Maggie Y.

description:
...I don't think I've ever had such a positive reaction to frosting. Ever. I just wanted to start with that, because I found that I was eating the frosting first. And to think I was going to scrape it off with a spoon...

Anyway, I went here after a surprisingly pleasant trip to the post office. I didn't really deserve a cupcake, but...they looked so beautiful, and I thought...you only live once, and there should be a cupcake for every day of --

But I digress. I got a chocolate-vanilla cupcake and it was pretty tasty. It might've been the one that I picked up, but the cake itself could have stood to be a little more moist. It was a bit crumby, but...the frosting. The frosting was so good. It had this wonderful, light texture that I enjoyed immensely, kind of like having a delicious melted-esque marshmallow that's light and fluffy and...kinda like whipped cream. I dunno. Look, that's the thing that really stood out to me on that cupcake, and it was all I thought about on the way to work, budgeting when my diet would allow me another cupcake from this place.

Plus, the service was lovely. No one was there when I came in, but I didn't notice right away since I was admiring the handiwork of the cupcake decorating. When the gentleman came out, he was the most jovial person ever and was so accommodating. I must say, he certainly has the spirit of a cupcake, if cupcakes had spirit.

I'd personally go back just for the frosting on the cake and the great service. The cupcake was tasty albeit needing a little more moisture, but according to some of the other reviews, the Tres Leches is where it's at in terms of a good, moist, flavorful cake. I don't doubt that and I'm all for heading back there.
author: Robbin A.

description:
Best tres leches cupcake I've ever had!

My fiancé always knows how to surprise me with the best treats. He exposed me to these delectable, delightful cupcakes a few years ago. And they never let me down. 

Whenever he brings me home a tres leches cupcake from here, I swoon!!! Ahhhhhhhh! These cakes are little clouds from heaven. Unbelievably moist, tender cake, succulent milky texture and light fluffy whipped cream. Perfect sweetness. Not sugary. Just right.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: The sweet tooth in you is definitely satisfied. Their mini cupcakes are the perfect size and I love them :)
author: Sunitha B.

description:
Customer service was on point (thank you to the gentleman holding down the fort today- he was the only one in there from what I could tell) and the cupcakes tasted great. 

The regular size cupcake was about $3.30 (I can't remember exactly) which isn't bad compared to other places in the area ---this is the FIDI after all.

I will be coming back.
author: Claudia S.

description:
3.5

The cupcakes here are super cute!!!buve tried the coconut and carrot cake so far. The owner is very helpful & really nice. The first time I came here was with my supervisor. We bought 5 & he told us he would throw in another for free. 

The coconut one was very tasty. I love the flavor of coconut so I wish there was a bigger taste to it. The cake batter itself was semi-moist, but definitely could've been better.

The carrot cake was actually better than the coconut cupcake. It had actual carrot in it and I absolutely loved the cream cheese frosting. It was the perfect sweetness. I want carrot cake now that I'm talking about it..... The strawberry one looked really yummy. We bought the last big one. 

I like their concept of having a mini and a regular size cupcake for each flavor. Perfect for people to try out what they like before knowing to buy a full size cupcake. 

This is a place I would come back to if I was in the area, but would not go out of my way to get here.
author: Dianna C.

description:
The cupcakes are not dry but I wouldn't say they are moist, the crumb is a little tough and crumbly (thats pastry talk) and I was not a fan of their frosting.  The frosting on the Hot Chocolate cupcake was just a whipped cream with very little sugar and no flavoring (like vanilla) in it.  I could appreciate the lightness and it was apprope for the topping on a "hot chocolate" confection, but aside from this what else makes this cupcake "hot chocolate" flavored?  Nothin... I found it pretty boring TBH.  

The vanilla-chocolate cupcake is a combo I typically dig- deep choclate cake and buttery rich vanilla icing.   This one was vanilla/chocoalte swirled cake as well as icing.  The cake was OK, did not scream chocolate or vanilla in particular, the frosting tasted like it was a decent chocolate ganache, dampened by a blah vanilla buttercream.  It YEARNED for a pinch of salt!  I'm not talking about how everybody wants salted caramel this and sea salted that I just mean toss a pinch of salt in dat frosting yo!

I fear I shan't be back :""( 

I really want to find out if Batter Bakery srsly has cupcakes.  I've read it on YELP but where the heck are they in that lil phone booth?!? I don't want to just be like "one cupcake please" all matter of fact, what if they dont have any and then I just look like a FOOL!!!
author: Emma H.

description:
Yes! Finally another cupcake shop in FiDi. 

The place always has cupcakes and cakepops, and about 5-6 basic flavors. The minis are somewhere around $1.75 and the regular cupcakes are $3. BUT...they're currently giving out samples of some of their mini-cupcakes, so even though I spent the $3 and change for my cupcake, I got to eat a mini one for free! Loves it.

I sampled the red velvet, which was pretty good, but the tres leches that I got BLEW ME AWAY. OH YUM. I couldn't eat it fast enough. My boss interrupted me before I was able to inhale the whole thing (bad idea) and while he was updating me on some tasks, I couldn't stop staring longingly at the uneaten half of the cupcake. 

Get it. Got it? Good.
author: Annie S.

description: Delicious cupcakes and friendly staff. Easy to order a dozen cupcakes if your potluck dessert remains unbaked. I love the variety of flavors - the tres leches, red velvet, strawberry...need I say more? The only downside I see with this place is the proximity to my office (it's in the heart of the financial district at Crocker Galleria) - it makes it hard to stay away.
author: Anna V.

description:
I bought a dozen hot cocoa cupcakes. It was beautifully decorated. Chocolate with marshmallows on top of a chocolate cupcake. Cake was moist and yummy. The clerk was friendly and helped me store the cupcakes in a box. 

He even threw in a mini cupcake for me to sample!
author: Wendy H.

description: Happened to sit down and saw this place I went on Yelp to check it out after seeing good reviews.. I got 4 cupcakes for my roommate she loved them..... Friendly staff will definitely come back for sure!
author: Nels R.

description: I placed a special rush order for cake pops for an event, and they went out of their way to be available for pickup on a Saturday. The pops are adorable and you can customize them in any way you can imagine, plus they are super tasty. Very grateful that they do such creative work here and will certainly order again!
author: Carrie S.

description:
In the world of Sprinkles, Kara's Cupcakes, Sift, I sure appreciate relatively-unknown and non-chain dessert stores. There's a certain care and love they put into making their food, and you can taste the difference. 

In this case, it's all about the Tres Leches cupcakes. Mini or regular size, they are TO DIE for. I'm a sucker for milk and sugar, and when you fused three kinds of milk into a dessert, you've got me sold! In this case of La Luna's Tres Leches cupcakes, they are my absolute favorite. Creamy sweetness (but not overwhelmingly too creamy or too sweet) is what I can only describe my absolute favorite flavor. 

The cashier's customer service skills have a lot left to be desired; very impersonable and allergic to smiling. But who cares, she is the gatekeeper to this heavenly and highly addictive place. At least 2x weekly I buy not one, but two dozen of these crack-filled mini cupcakes. 

At less than $1.50 for a mini and $3 for regular-sized cupcake, pricing is on par with other designer cupcakes, but still doesn't make it right, hence the 4 stars. I haven't tried any other flavors, so I can't speak for them, but this place is definitely worth checking out if you happen to randomly stroll into the Crocker Galleria for.... random shopping? (PS/ the boutique stores in this "mall" are so niche and random I wonder how they manage to stay in business).
author: Carloalexi M.

description:
I used La Luna because our firm works with a number of La Cocina incubated shops.  I am always happy, but today I was in heaven.  

These cupcakes are amazing.  I ate three different ones myself, each better than the last.  The strawberry was everything good about strawberry cake.  The Tres Leches was smooth and moist, but not messy or hard to eat - and the oreo minis, I mean, come on, right?  Their frosting is light and not overwhelming, and this from someone who usually dumps all frosting in the trash and just east the cake parts.  

The ordering process for our baby shower work event was easy, cupcakes were ready on time, and the staff was friendly and helpful.

I will be getting only the strawberry (my fav) for my birthday.  This is 100% my new go-to cupcake shop!  Thanks so much! You made the mom-to-be feel very special, and me (the host) happy as can be!
author: Shannon N.

description: Phenomenal customer service - I actually wanted to lean over the counter and hug the guy he was so nice!!!'l this place is a true gem. Grateful to work so close, perfect for company birthday celebrations or little afternoon treats!
author: Kaitlyn V.

description: What a wonderful bakery! I ordered 20 red velvets for my boyfriend's birthday this week. It was easy to email and Elvia, the owner, was very responsive and informative. The price was on point, and it was easy to pay ahead of time with square. The cupcakes are stunners, and taste amazing! I am so, so happy how it all turned out. Also they are a very well-run shop, with great service; they even let me pick them up on a day they are closed. Very accomodating, responsive,  And when I found out that they are part of La Cocina, I was thrilled to support local businesses. Highly recommended!
author: Miriam L.

description:
Fro-yo girl here. La Luna Cupcakes took over SoGreen's old Crocker Galleria space. The décor hasn't changed much (same tables, same tiled walls, same counter, different chairs). They even have two fro-yo machines though they only had one flavor, Straus plain, during my visit. Cupcakes come in two sizes, $3 regular, $1.25 mini. They also have cake pops ($2). The website lists savory cupcake (different idea) but they didn't have any. 

Cupcake flavors of the day:
* Vanilla: the cake was not moist and tasted average, the frosting was creamy and light with nice Madagascar vanilla flavor but it was toooo sweet
* Chocolate: the average tasting cake wasn't moist, vanilla buttercream frosting was too sweet
* Red velvet
* Cookies n' cream
* Nutella
* Tres leches

The plain tart fro-yo ($3.75 includes two toppings) was creamy, sweet, mildly tangy and light with a funky real yogurt flavor. It wasn't bad though it was a bit clumpy and I like tangier fro-yo. They only had 6 kinds of toppings: strawberries, blueberries, chocolate chips, walnuts and 2 kinds of sprinkles. The berries are kept in the fridge. The strawberries were fresh. 

They have a reward program called Belly.

You know you love me. X0 X0, fro-yo girl.
author: Lolia S.

description: Their tres leches cupcakes are very delicious! The service was good and speedy. Very clean. Coming back again for sure!
author: Betty M.

description: I just had the most delicious strawberry cupcake I've ever had in my life! The cake was super moist and full of flavor. The icing was delectable. The service was great too! Bring cash or get charged .85 cents to use your card unless your purchase is over $5.
author: Vivian B.

description: Purchased a cake pop for my daughter. She usually inhales these things, as they are only a couple bites.... well this time i see her sucking on it like a lolly pop... wondering whats going on, i try to squeeze it. The cake pop is ROCK SOLID..... so i called, where the lady lied to me and told me they were fresh.  We live in the neighborhood, and have tried this place a few times. The cakes are VERY bland (think box cake) and the cake pops are not edible. She offered me a replacement if i wanted to walk back over there, with a screaming child that just had her rancid cake pop taken from her.  I think this place just doesnt do enough business for the display case they have....shit gets old, and they arent honest enough to not sell it to you.
author: Love U.

description: Had the Tres Leches cupcake here. Authentic tres leches cake in cupcake form. The cake was super moist and oozing with milk filling. Any more filling, and it would have been dripping all over my fingers. Definitely coming back.
author: Dwayne J.

description: Friendly service and great cupcakes! I went over and the owner/chef(?) was decorating beautiful looking cake pops. He even offered to do a custom decoration for me. I decided to go for a red velvet mini and it was delicious - moist and great cream cheese frosting. It only costed $1.50 and perfect size. Next time I will be over to get more and for that pour-over coffee too.
author: Neha M.

description: Customer service was good, cupcakes weren't great. A tad on the dry side and nothing to remember. The oreo was stale/old on the cookies & cream cupcake.
author: Renee F.

description:
Man are these cupcakes moist! 

I bought a sampler (4 mini cupcakes) for my coworker who is on her last day working with our company. The guy behind the counter (I'm guessing the owner) was extremely nice and friendly. I was asking him all sorts of questions about his cupcakes and he even let me sample a mini one. It was DELICIOUS. It was the tres leches and it was sooooo good! There was a liquidy filling inside the cupcake which was a very nice surprise. Definitely coming back when I'm feeling like treating myself to an afternoon treat.
author: Lina L.

description: We ordered these cupcakes for a work event. They delivered to the Financial District, and they were absolutely amazing. Interesting flavors and gluten free options for our coworkers with allergies!
author: Natasha B.

description:
My wife loves cupcakes... so as a good husband when I see a new place open up I always stop in a pick her up a couple.  I typically go with a Red Velvet and one other random flavor that looks good...

I was very disappointed with La Luna... 

1.  They cupcake is small.  I would say it is about 20% smaller then your standard cupcake (no I did not buy a mini).  When you are paying $3... you can give a standard size cupcake.
2.  The cupcakes were dry.  The Red Velvet was a little moist, but the Neopolitan was so dry I thew half of it out... that is like throwing $1.50 ($1.62 with tax) in the trash.. although if you looked in the trash you would think I only threw out 1/4 of a cupcake because these cupcakes are TOO SMALL!

So all in all it was a lose lose.  If they were awesome I could forgive the price to size ratio....
author: John F.

description: We've used La Luna cupcakes for a couple of small work events and they were a hit. The chocolate frosting is delicious, and the tres leches and mocha cupcakes are my favorites so far. Great friendly service too, they're very patient and eager to help
author: Julie O.

description:
This review is based on taste alone without regard to price, size or value because my amazing friend bought me a dozen of their mini-cupcakes as a gift.

Chocolate: Full of rich, decadent cocoa flavor without being too sweet

Tres Leches: The standout and my personal favorite. So sweet and moist while still maintaining a fluffy texture. Does justice to its name with its soft, milky flavor

Sunny Vanilla: Pretty standard but good nonetheless

Mars Red Velvet: A tad too sweet for me, but I appreciated the thicker texture

Mocha Chocolate: Interesting contrast but I wasn't a big fan of the mocha, which tasted almost spicy

Asteroid Cookies & Cream: LIke eating the ice-cream in cake form, though I found it a bit too sweet like the red velvet
author: Josephine L.

description:
Had lunch at the Galleria and thought I'd get the office mates an afternoon snack so I stopped in La Luna to do the good deed.

Cute shop and I liked how the cupcakes were all nicely displayed.  I just got a dozen of the mini cupcakes which were only $1.50 per, which was not too bad.  I got a mix of whatever they had ranging from vanilla, coconut, chocolate, cookies & cream, just to name a few.

The guy that helped me out was so kind and delicately handled each cupcake into the box like it was a fragile work of art.

When I got back to work, the office mates seemed to like it (or were just saying it) but I had a vanilla cupcake and thought it was a little dry.  The frosting however was really good.  However, I also tried the chocolate cupcake and it was moist, but I didn't like the frosting!

Overall, nice Mom & Pop spot to get some non pretentious cupcakes.

#SweetsInTheFiDi
author: Nick D.

description:
Tres Leches!  

I haven't heard of La Luna Cupcakes until I attended the Yelp Elite Promenade Ball.  Fortunate enough, La Luna was one of the vendors to offer samples. 

 As soon as I tried the Tres Leches, meaning 3 milk, I know I have to have more!  The cake is very moist in the middle and the cream frosting is very light.  I do see other reviews saying that the cake is dry, that may be true for the other flavors as I didn't try anything else, but god the Tres Leches was moist, even after a day in the refrigerator.

The price is $3 per cupcake, which I'm fine with.  Compare to Kara's cupcake and some other cupcake shops in the Bay Area, this is a comparable price.  However, nothing compares to the quality of Tres Leches.

Thanks again to a great elite event!
author: Johnny G.

description:
Located in the financial district, Luna cupcakes is located inside the Mall-looking area right outside Montgomery BART station.

These cupcakes are definitely the best I've ever had. I came in almost half and hour before they closed. Every cupcake I ate was luscious, light, and fluffy. Not too sweet, not too bland, just right.

Oh, just to keep in mind, if you're on a froyo crave, they clean up and turn off the machines around 5:15-5:30ish.

I tried three different cupcakes: La Luna Tres Leches, and the Chocolate with Chocolate
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-luna-cupcakes-san-francisco-2?select=Ye_peFMBMfXTJ2BuqBwfxw#SjPUafBWdKRDMKsWXthoqw

Asteroid Cookies and Cream was definitely my favorite!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-luna-cupcakes-san-francisco-2?select=Ye_peFMBMfXTJ2BuqBwfxw#MvjXp3uj0HEkVLDz3GEnzw

Definitely a great spot for my sweet tooth, and I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Sophia G.

description: Love this little place.  Stopped in for a sugar fix with the GF and this has become my new favorite place.  Young man named Jose helped me out and was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the cupcakes.  Try the Mint, Red Velvet, or Chocolate!  They also have fresh Ice cream and Cupcake pops!  Perfect for the little people in your life!  Great family owned business and super friendly.
author: jori d.

description: Lit AF my Friend Since elementary school family owns the place & their super good I could honestly eat them all day. so many unique flavors, highly recommended. Not the cheapest but worth it, every step of the way
author: Michael C.

description:
I gave La luna 4 stars for their tres leche cupcake! it is super goooood! they lost 1 star from me because the cupcake size is pretty small for $3.75 :(

It's a nice cupcake cafe in downtown SF (at galeria) to hang out w/ friends or only by yourself. haven't tried any other flavors because I already got hooked w/ one flavor. lol
author: Miss G.

description:
I've been following La Luna since they did catering at Phillz Coffee in Berkeley. Coffee & cupcakes? What a delightful fix during late night study sessions at Cal! I also love how they are creative with their yummy cakes, really listening to customer requests/suggestions. (I once heard that they created a breast shaped cake for one of their catering jobs, lol, and have you seen their Twitter cupcakes?!) When I found out they were opening up a shop in the financial district, I knew I had to attend the 
grand opening. It was very fun and festive with music and free samples. I met the lovely business owners, a very sweet mother and daughter pair. Just tried the newest fusion Neo cupcake to share with my boyfriend and he couldn't stop eating it! Can't wait to see what other tasty delights y'all come up with!
author: Jessica K.

description:
The Red Velvet was very good. Moist and not too sweet. I can't decide whether to get the Tres Leches or the Oreo and the owner gave me the Tres Leches for free! Sweet!!!
I will definitely come back.
author: Jingle A.

description: My co-workers & I decided to treat ourselves (treat yoself) and get a cupcake after lunch. The pretty cupcakes in this shop lured us in and we were oohing and ahhing over the different treats while waiting in line. After what seemed like an eternity it was our turn. The clerk was pleasant, but his communication was limited & as greedy new customers we had a few questions. He had other customers so he indicated that someone else would come to help us. About 5 minutes later another employee emerged from the back. It seems her shorts were already royally bunched because she came out of the gate with major 'tude. "What is the frosting on this one?", "it is the frosting".....mmkay. We settled on a few mini cupcakes and they were alright - nothing to bust your diet for. The frosting was better than the actual cupcake, but again both mediocre at best.
author: Royal S.

description: A cute little shop with decent cupcakes... Strawberry frosting taste pretty fresh and the service is excellent.
author: Ashlie B.

description:
The frosting is "powdery" and the cake itself tasted like Betty Crocker cake mix. 

Cupcake Cove, Cupkates (the food truck), Miette all offers way better cupcake than La Luna within walking distance of financial district.
author: Maggie C.

description:
This is my first cupcake review in SF. I used to be a total cupcake addict until I went to sugar rehab recently, but when I was at the Crocker Galleria yesterday getting some coffee, I needed a sugar fix with it!

The store itself is very clean and welcoming with a nice display area. I was torn between the peanut butter cup and the green tea, but eventually went for the green tea since apparently it was the new flavor.

The good thing about the cupcake was that it wasn't super sugary like other places tend to be; however, I feel that there just wasn't enough sugar. I also found it to be a bit dry, but I loved the frosting. Everything about the frosting was perfect; it was fluffy and delicious. Unfortunately though, the frosting did not make up for the dryness of the cupcake as a whole.

I'll probably go back and try another flavor to give them a fair shot, maybe it was just this particular cupcake that was dry. My biggest complaint is that the cupcakes are pretty small for $3. The price of cupcakes in general is ridiculous right now and I think that for $3 there should be more substance.
author: Jennifer P.

description: The Cupcakes are so delicious and moist; the atmosphere is so relaxing; customer service is great; a perfect walk around the corner from work too!
author: Jesse M.

description:
I revert back to my seven year-old self whenever I go to La Luna. I'm not sure why that is...

Ok, I'll act my age instead of my shoe size. Breaking it down...

1) The cupcakes - Oh my. Seriously. I haven't tried all the flavours, but the ones I have are pretty, pretty amazing. Tres leches, peanut butter, chocolate, the one with the mini-oreo... Just the right amount of sweetness, good textures and enough quirkiness to make the eating experience not just pleasurable, but memorable. 

2) The customer service - The cupcakes are A+, but what takes La Luna to caketastic levels is its customer service. Maybe it's because it's a family business, but there's an extra level of care and sincerity that I appreciate. I'll give you an example; my friend bought a panda cake pop and dropped it shortly after buying it. Cue smashed panda face. The people at La Luna responded by giving her a new one. Just like that, no second thoughts.

3) The cleanliness - You know what it's like when you go to a food place and things seem a bit...mucky? Not my type of place. Well, don't worry because La Luna is VERY clean. Aces in my book. 

Now I've deconstructed my childlike enthusiasm I'll know why I react the way I do when I buy cupcakes from this place. Hopefully you'll have the same reaction... :-)
author: Sazza R.

description:
I was fortunate enough to get a few free cupcakes at the latest yelp event from La Luna. A big thank you! I had the tres leches and it was probably one of the best tres leches cupcakes I've had. Super moist, light and fluffy with a frothy and yummy inside. Not too sweet at all. The mini cupcakes here are about 3 bite cupcakes. The regular cupcakes are notably smaller than most average cupcakes.

Overall, good tasting tres leches gives a lot of promise to the other cupcakes they have.  They have your standard run of the mill chocolate, red velvet, vanilla, but their tres leches is their signature cupcake worth talking about. The major problem is that these are pretty pricey! So the value to quality ratio makes this place lose a star, unfortunately.
author: Christine B.

description:
I got hooked after a cake tasting but was confused by the not so high ratings. But then when I thought about it, La Luna can definitely be a hit or miss depending on the flavors.

My favorites are Tres Leches and the berry cupcake. I tried the Strawberry, but the frosting did seem oily and overall tasted a bit too artificial. I'm glad none of my cupcakes were ever dry (as some previous yelper complained of back in 2013), so maybe that means they've improved? I would like to try more flavors eventually but after going 3 days in a row, I need a little break.

I appreciate that this place does cupcakes with whipped frosting that is lighter and less sweet. American buttercream can be so heavy, sweet, and overwhelming sometimes.
author: Sandy T.

description:
04/03/2013

Bakery is clean, moderately sized, but overall - nothing special.

*This review is strictly for my first time visit without ever having a cupcake, and for the overall service. 2 stars, 1 star for service, and 1 star at attempting to sell a cupcake. 
I have heard of La Luna Cupcakes through the reviews on YELP, and I was happy to hear about its new location opening up near where I work. 

*Originally, I decided to stop by La Luna for a celebratory cupcake or two (for a friend who has a new job and for myself of course), but left empty handed due to service. There was only one associate at the time, and he was helping several customers (African male), and so I waited until it was my turn. Here is our conversation:

Me: Do you have any savory cupcakes?

Associate: (Looks at the refrigerator to the left of the register) Oh, our baker did not make any today because we anticipated a lack of business.

Me: (To be honest, they had very few cupcakes to show and to sell, which made it undesirable) Oh, is this all the cupcakes you have at the moment?

Associate: (Looks at the cupcakes) Yeah, our baker has stepped out and I don't know about her whereabouts, in fact, I don't know when she'll return. I would ask her to make a batch of something that you would perhaps like, but she isn't here.

Me: (Not impressed at all) Alright, do you have any cake pops?

Associate: (Looks at the refrigerator again) Let me check in the back. (Comes back out with a sugar coated cake pop) Oh, it looks like we have vanilla which is vanilla cake dipped in white chocolate and coated with sanding sugar.

Me: How about Mars Red Velvet?

Associate: (Apparently there is someone in the back) Let me go check one more time. (Associate comes back with a very small sugared pink cake pop).

Me: Wow, the pictures online seem bigger. Do they not come any bigger than what you have? (Online, the Mars Red Velvet cake pops look massive, quite like a Chinese fried sesame ball).

Associate: (Looking stunned) Yeah, they are enlarged online to show depth. Honestly, I am trying to perhaps ask you to come back tomorrow. Our baker has stepped out, and there would be more offerings if she were here, but she isn't. We weren't expecting any business at all.

Me: (The associate pretty much just asked me to return the next day. Do not question your own question when you are already suggesting). I wanted a cupcake today for a friend. Never mind then.

*The associate was very defensive, and he felt the need to repeat himself that the "baker has stepped out" and that her whereabouts were unknown......"

*Of all the cupcakeries that I have been to, this is the first one that asks a customer to return the next day because they simply did not bake all of their offerrings. From a service evaluation standpoint, I only have one word, "problematic". I thought it was a great idea to venture outside the cupcakeries that I've come to know: Sprinkles (not the best, mainly big in name for creating the cupcake fad), Magnolia (timeless, New York favorite - but overly sweet), CAKO (bay area bakery, not bad, not original, and sometimes overly sweet), Kara's (my favorite, and will continue buying from them), and then there's La Luna (I have not tried any of their cupcakes, but why should I?).

*Never assume what kind of day it will be in terms of business. You advertise "Savory Cupcakes", and yet you don't bother making any to sell. Savory cupcakes have become a hit across seas (Hong Kong in particular), and people actually enjoy them as if they were a single meal. Your cupcakes look amazing, but I might just stick to businesses that I know and trust. La Luna, I am sorry, but I won't be a customer to your establishment.

Next cupcakery on my mind? Georgetown Cupake!
author: Alex C.

description:
La Luna is yet another cute cupcakery with average, unremarkable cupcakes. Presentation is stark, with each cupcake decorated with a simple swirl of frosting and maybe a candy object on top. The chocolate cake was dry without a very rich flavor; the chocolate frosting was too hard in contrast to the cake. Vanilla was just that...plain old vanilla. The red velvet was similarly plain (though I've never been a huge fan of red velvet to begin with -- red food coloring? Come on...) but at least the cream cheese frosting was pretty tasty. The biggest success here was the tres leches, which no doubt stayed moist because of...well...the tres leches. If you come here at all I might actually go for the frozen yogurt, which ironically tastes pretty different compared to the other fad that keeps popping up: DIY frozen yogurt shops. La Luna's froyo is creamy, just barely sweetened, and actually tastes like yogurt - natural and refreshing.

The problem with cupcakes is that they've become so popularized that in order to stand out from your competitors, you've got to do one of two things: 1) create an outstanding cupcake 2) decorate outrageously. Unfortunately, La Luna didn't hit the mark on either of those, so for me it remains very middle of the road: just one of many cupcakeries around the city.
author: Clarice W.

description:
2 words: TRES LECHES

I love their Tres Leches cupcakes. Their berry ones are great too.

So everyone complains about the size. Just know that they have MINI ones and regular sized ones. No they are not GIANT cupcakes like some other cupcake places, but geez America, does everything have to be giant for you to feel like you got your money's worth? What about quality? 

This place has different flavors that rotate in and out and I love trying new ones when I come in but I definitely have my go to favorites. 

And the owner's are so nice and are always so accommodating. I love this place.
author: Clogozm C.

description:
The service was wonderfully warm, so much so that I found myself wishing they had cupcakes to match. Unfortunately - though the location is darling and feels really clean- I found the cupcake to be dry and over-iced. If I can't taste the chocolate in a chocolate cupcake...I think something may be wrong :(.

Seriously though, the owners are incredibly sweet and kind, I'd support them just for that.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Terrible.  Sure, it's pretty inside but what they're selling isn't anything special.  I wasn't sure I bought into them being smaller than regular cupcakes, until I used one of their containers to transport a Cupkates Truck cupcake home and the Cupcakes cupcake wouldn't even fit in the box!  I'd say they are 20% smaller, and this wasn't even a mini.

I'm a cupcake aficionado.  I've tried most places in the Bay Area, and this one ranks near the bottom, just above Cako and Cupcake Cove. 

Vanilla Chocolate - Dry as can be, pretty with the swirl, but not great tasting.

Tres Leches:  Very tasty, but the bottom was soggy and falling apart.  The texture made it seem like I was eating food that had gone bad.  Great flavor, but texture not so much.

Lemon:  Lemon cake with lemon buttercream.  So unspecial it should be removed from the menu immediately.  Or replaced with a Lemon Meringue cupcake.

Strawberry:  See Lemon above.  Nothing special at all about this cupcake either.  Dry strawberry cake, too sweet strawberry frosting.

Hot Chocolate:  Cute with the marshmallows, but it's just a chocolate cupcake.  

Red Velvet:  Too sweet, too dry.  Everyone makes this variety, so get one elsewhere.  

I may have tried a few others since they've been open, but they're completely unmemorable, and there has never been a savory one on the menu.  This place needs to take a page from Cupkates book, or Republic of Cake in Orinda where the cupcakes are original, inventive, have great fillings and are topped with something other than sickeningly sweet buttercream.  BE ORIGINAL!  BE UNIQUE!  Do not be yet another place selling mediocre cupcakes.  I hope this place goes out of business soon, and considering it's always empty when I pass by, I'm sure that'll happen soon.
author: Yolanda B.

description: Wow... I've been looking for the best cupcakes in the city and I think I found them here! I'm a huge cupcake fan and the Tres Leches one is now on top of the list for me...  I also had a vanilla and chocolate cupcake and the frosting was delicious!! You can really taste the love they put into each cupcake... Definitely coming back!
author: S D.

description: Love their cupcakes....ESP the chocolate one....the sponge cake was really soft and the frosting is to die for!
author: Rashmi R.

description: Delicious!! Moist cake, yummy icing. The strawberry tastes so fresh instead of artificial!
author: Laura M.

description: I come here after work each time i have a cupcake craving, love the Tres Leches that's the best because it's soft and gooey yummy inside. Chocolate cupcake is also delicious!
author: Lizzy D.

description:
Passing by the Crocker Galleria and heard the sounds of a Mariachi band.  The band was playing in front of La Luna Cupcakes for their grand opening.

They were passing out mini cupcakes and refreshments.  Tried the red velvet and chocolate cupcakes.  The chocolate cupcake was good, but the red velvet was a little dry.  

Would like to come back and try out the regular cupcakes in the near future.
author: Al L.

description: Best cupcake store in San Francisco , unique flavors, perfectly decorated, I order cupcakes here for any special occasion, they never disappoint, the owners are the best,
author: Adriana L.

description: Elvia was SO easy to work with and super accommodating! I had custom cakepops made for my boyfriend's bday and they looked amazing (exactly how I had asked) and more than that, they were delicious! People wanted more than one! Would definitely go here again for any special occasion!
author: Melissa R.

description: I'd been hearing buzz about this recently opened FiDi cupcakery so during a recent SF visit, the daughter and I indulged.  She devoured her tres leches mini, loving it so much that she ate most of a full-size tres leches at home after dinner later that evening. I had the basic vanilla and found it to be quite good.  Service was friendly. The shop was clean and bright.  BART is a block away so I'll have to remember to stop in when I'm in the area.
author: Julie C.

description:
I went to their grand opening today which was really nice! They served a selection of mini cupcakes, samples of their froyo, and even had refreshments. Their tres leches cupcake is delicious! Super soft and has cream in the middle. The frosting was also good and not too sweet. The red velvet was decent, but the strawberry was a little dry. The frosting on the strawberry was also a little too hard. They also served a yellow cake with a hazelnut frosting. The frosting was done well and reminded me of nutella but I would have liked to have it paired with a chocolate cake.

The froyo consistency was great, and more on the tart side which I enjoy. The prices for cupcake and froyo are very reasonable. $3 for a regular, $30 for a dozen. The froyo is $3.75 and includes 2 toppings. Definitely try the tres leches and they said they will change flavors all the time so I'm sure there will be other tasty additions to come!
author: Alice J.

description:
I've gotten mini cupcakes from here a couple of times for special occasions. They're super cute - hot chocolate was the cutest, tres leches was the most delicious.

If I just wanted to eat a cupcake, this probably wouldn't be my first choice as it is a bit overpriced, but when you want to bring a dozen cute mini cupcakes for an event and they are conveniently nearby, I say go for it. The container is also really convenient, they are safely contained, don't roll around and are easy to carry.
author: Christine H.

description:
I am disappointed to say that these are the worst cupcakes I have ever eaten. They were dry and tasteless with overly sweet and oily frosting.  We tried chocolate, vanilla, tres leches and red velvet.  The red velvet had hardly risen at all - it looked more like a red cookie.  I don't even understand how La Luna is in business.  I make cupcakes for fun and know that every person who has tried my cupcakes would hands down prefer them to anything La Luna is selling.  And baking's not even my profession.

I was excited to discover La Luna because its only a 2 minute walk from my office, but when I find myself needing cupcakes for corporate events I will be walking a few extra blocks to Batter, who really know their stuff.
author: Sarah E.

description: After doing some serious market research, I must say that La Luna has the best taste to price ratio. They have a variety of delicious cupcakes beyond your standard flavors and offer them in mini size, too! Most of the big name bakeries seem to only sell the standard vanilla, chocolate and redvelvet for mini dozens, but here you can get tres leches, berrys, chocolate swirl, coconut, etc and at a better price. I'm a fan.
author: Netta A.

description: Their  Tres Leches is the best cupcake in the city. So moisture, flavorful, delicate and delicious! Absolutely addictive. Tried different places. Nothing even close. Hooked. Forever.
author: Anna T.

description: My company dropped off some cupcakes as a holiday gift and I was super stoke , who can say no to cupcake even if you are watching what you eat. I had two boxes with two of the same flavor. It was a vanilla cupcake with some kind of frosting. The frosting was different and light but darn the cake was super dry. Took one bite and that was it!!!
author: Nhung T.

description: La Luna might be why my jeans don't fit...I spent almost a year attending school nearby and ended lunch with a cupcake way too many times. The people who work there are the sweetest, especially the man...he's such a happy, genuinely positive guy that it's impossible to be in a bad mood around him. The cupcakes are absolutely delicious- I don't recommend the vanilla, but the Tres Leches, Chocolate, Cookies and Cream, and Carrot Cake are all ridiculously good. This is still the first place I head when I'm spending the day in the city. Love!
author: Kristen M.

description: The place is spotless. The clerk and the baker are really friendly. They open at 10 and once helped me get my cupcakes by 9 in the morning! WHO ELSE WOULD DO THAT!? The clerk gave me a sample of the mini cupcake for taste (RED VELVET) which in my opinion is delicious! My favorite is the TRES LECHES. It taste the exact same. If you guys are around the Financial District and want a cupcake. Try them! They're the best I've had so far!
author: Andrea S.

description:
My thoughtful co- worker just brought me a cupcake for my birthday and it was amazing! It was a yellow cake with whipped cream frosting and strawberries inside the cake. The cake and the cream were SO fresh and light and moist. The fruit was tasty and the right amount for the cupcake. 
I see the other poor reviews here and I wonder if I just really lucked out. But that was yummy, for sure!
author: Mom P.

description: Great assortment of flavors and perfect for a bite of cake. The reviews are correct about the size. These are x-small yummy bites for the cost of a mini cupcakes elsewhere. Overall, they were delicious but a little overpriced.
author: Tiffany E.

description: Disappointing! I was excited to try them so I bought 6 cupcakes for $20.00. I bought 2 mocha cupcakes, 1 tres leche, 1 s'mores, 1 red velvet, and 1 vanilla... All of them were dried out completely and tasted like 3 day old cupcakes. I bake all of the time and I have never tasted such a dried out cupcake!  I was so embarrassed because I gave these cupcakes away as a gift and after tasting them, I should have just went to Cako cupcakes or baked them myself. The frosting wasn't bad but when you have a dried out cupcake, it doesn't matter how great the frosting is. Will not be going back nor recommending this place to others.
author: Erin M.

description: Bought four mini cupcakes in a package from Eat Real festival today. Asked about the cupcakes and the lady said there is a red velvet, strawberry, vanilla and vanilla and chocolate mini cup cakes. I ate the red velvet: delicious as expected. Moist cake and creamy cream cheese frosting! I bit into the vanilla and it was actually the tres leche cupcake! WHAT A DELICIOUS SURPRISE! Soooooooo GOOOD! I wanted more after and even licked the wrapper. The chocolate and vanilla was ehhh. And I'm saving the strawberry. Definitely want to grab a bigger size of red velvet and tres leche cupcakes!
author: Marn S.

description: One of my favorite desserts of all time is Tres Leches cake which you cannot find often so when I searched for desserts and someone mentioned a Tres Leches cupcake... It was on. On the first floor or sub-basement I arrived to a little shop and my craving for a bit of sweets was satisfied.
author: Tri N.

description: I've been here once before to "support" local business and thought I'd give it another try even though my last experience wasn't that good.  Ordered the mocha cupcake this time and honestly I've made better cupcakes at home using Duncan Hines cake mixes!  The coffee was "brewed" for me and it was terrible!  Considering what they charge for the cupcake & coffee I really expected better.  If you have a craving for cupcakes, I'd go to Kara's whenever possible!
author: Liza C.

description: the tres leches cupcake is oh so good - berry one is second best -  the straus frozen yogurt is an awesome distraction .
author: Wakako U.

description: I went to their Grand Opening party today after work, I'm bummed I missed the mostly female Mariachi band! But what I got was the most delicious  Tres Leches cupcake I have ever tasted, my favorite cake from childhood. Oh my, the frosting was creamy and not too sweet and the cake itself was delectably moist and infused with the 3 milks it's famous for without being mushy! It was amazing from the first to last bite...I will be back!!
author: Mira L.

description: I came here today to buy some cupcakes for my co-workers birthday. I bought 4 mini cupcakes - red velvet, mocha, peanut butter, and vanilla/chocolate swirl. I couldn't decide between the mocha and tres leche flavor and asked the lady working which one she preferred. Since I picked the mocha one, she gave me the tres leche one for free to try out! The tres leche was really moist, and not too sweet.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Wow!  Delicious!!  I love the variety that this places has and in different sizes!  Great for ordering the minis for work events.
They also started selling savory cupcakes.  Today, I tried the New York, New York - a custard cupcake / muffin with havarti cheese, dill, and smoked salmon - kind of like a quiche but better and beautiful like a cupcake!
author: Caroline P.

description: Carrot cake cupcake was yummy. But the chocolate cupcake was dry. The way each cupcake looked was very cute! The people working their was nice. And they had indoor/outdoor seating which was convenient.
author: Christina V.

description: Elvia made mini cupcakes for our wedding. They were all scrumptious but my favorites were the fruit, tres leches, chocoloate/vanilla swirl and strawberry: each flavor came through individually instead of a blanket sweetness. She even made a gluten-free carrot cupcake for our allergic guests. She also came and arranged a lovely, artful set-up. Elvia is the best
author: shoshana l.

description: I got the Vanilla-Chocolate combo cupcake.  At $3.26 for one "large" cupcake, this is not worth it and I will not be returning.  The cake part was dry and tasteless, the cream, while light, was way too sugary.  It's really not that hard to get cupcakes right.  Very disappointing.
author: Meytal M.

description: Wanted to like them and to support this small la cucina inspired business - cupcakes i thought were overpriced and a little dry for me but perhaps i came too late in the day.  Also asked for a latte and was given a regular coffee instead.  I had already paid snd tipped when i mentioned the error the barrista said i know you ordered latte but we only have regular coffee - em perhaps she could have explained that?
author: Joan M.

description: at first, i thought the cake was too dense but the frosting was really good.  then i realized that this cupcake is not like the cako's or cupcake cove, it's more like the old fashioned cupcake with real frosting. point in case, the red velvet is what a red velvet should taste with real cream cheese frosting that gives a little tang. although i think the cake does tastes like it was from the fridge.  but i did go when they were just opening.  $3 for a regular size (don't except muffin size), it's not bad.  taste good.
author: Food Is L.
